title: (x) Can anyone identity this font for British Airways? - Mylius Sans (custom by Monotype for Newell and Sorrell) {Jan}
author: Alex Parke

comments.content: Thanks.Do you know of a face that is similar to the custom designed Mylius sans serif?
Since I’ve never seen a complete specimen of it I can’t really say.

I would say it almost seems like a customized version of [Gill Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20100313052321/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/gill-sans/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D72%26w%3D600%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DWORLD%2520OFFERS%2520HURGADA%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%252Cot.liga%26seed%3D23), which is somewhat predictable, almost, since the British seem to have an immense fondness for Gill Sans. If you change the W and U it might be hard to tell it apart from your sample at first glance.

- Mike Yanega
I agree Mike it is remarkable like Gills Sans. The British pound sign is somewhat different too. Thanks
